column4: so, the dapper installer cannot find my SATA drive, suggestions?
you don't have a choice, you have to work on it now and then.
I don't understand
that's the problem.  software evolves, it gets better and better, that's just how it works. to demand that it remains static would cause everything to break and fall apart.
I don't need much improvement, I just need security fixes until 2011
you seem to have a problem with reality - you're either going to have to get with the program or the program will get with you.
I think you have the problem with reality, upgrading a server to a new operating system every six months is insanity
who does that?
but feisty will be depracated in 6 months
I won't be getting security updates. How awful
so keep up and fix it
i take it you aren't an administrator
now really, are you suggesting I fix a depracated OS instead of using dapper? now who is having trouble with reality?
only when I have to, I am a dev
okay, well then you should either learn how to admin a box or get someone to help you admin it
that is the whole point of using a long-term ubuntu release
actually, I am adebian user for 7nearly 10 years, I'll just use debian stable
good idea, etch is pretty good, and you can just s/etch/stable/g and it'll catch the upgrades on its own.
i've been using debian for a decade as well.
then you see why I want to use dapper, not feisty :)

doesn't make a difference to me, the point is that you require a solution that is guaranteed to flat-line you in 4 years, not 2.  if running debian stable makes it work, then go for it.  i don't care why you want to run dapper. :)
right well, feisty won't flat line me for another 6 months
